question:
You are a math expert. When you respond, respond only with the Solution of the final Problem, thinking step by step. At the end of the Solution, when you give your final answer, write it in the form 'Final Answer: \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
Let $a,$ $b,$ $c$ be complex numbers such that
\begin{align*}
ab + 4b &= -16, \\
bc + 4c &= -16, \\
ca + 4a &= -16.
\end{align*}Enter all possible values of $abc,$ separated by commas.
inference:
$$ab+4b=-16\Rightarrow ab=-16-4b=-(4b+16)=-4(b+4)\Rightarrow a=-4\Rightarrow$$
$$bc+4c=-16\Rightarrow bc=-16-4c=-(4c+16)=-4(c+4)\Rightarrow b=-4\Rightarrow \text{Using (1)}$$
$$ca+4a=-16\Rightarrow ca=-16-4a=-(4a+16)=-4(a+4)\Rightarrow c=-4 \Rightarrow$$
$$abc=(-4)(-4)(-4)=64$$
Final Answer: \boxed{$64$}. I hope it is correct.
ground_truth:
Adding the equations, we get
\[ab + ac + bc + 4(a + b + c) = -48.\]Multiplying the equations by $c,$ $a,$ $b,$ respectively, we get
\begin{align*}
abc + 4bc &= -16c, \\
abc + 4ac &= -16a, \\
abc + 4ab &= -16b.
\end{align*}Adding all these equations, we get
\[3abc + 4(ab + ac + bc) = -16(a + b + c).\]Then
\begin{align*}
3abc &= -4(ab + ac + bc) - 16(a + b +c) \\
&= -4(ab + ac + bc + 4(a + b + c)) \\
&= (-4)(-48) = 192,
\end{align*}so $abc = \boxed{64}.$

question:

$$ca+4a=-16\Rightarrow ca=-16-4a=-(4a+16)=-4(a+4)\Rightarrow c=-4 \Rightarrow$$
$$abc=(-4)(-4)(-4)=64$$
Final Answer: \boxed{$64$}. I hope it is correct.

ground_truth:
Adding the equations, we get
\[ab + ac + bc + 4(a + b + c) = -48.\]Multiplying the equations by $c,$ $a,$ $b,$ respectively, we get
\begin{align*}
abc + 4bc &= -16c, \\
abc + 4ac &= -16a, \\
abc + 4ab &= -16b.
\end{align*}Adding all these equations, we get
\[3abc + 4(ab + ac + bc) = -16(a + b + c).\]Then
\begin{align*}
3abc &= -4(ab + ac + bc) - 16(a + b +c) \\
&= -4(ab + ac + bc + 4(a + b + c)) \\
&= (-4)(-48) = 192,
\end{align*}so $abc = \boxed{64}.$
